holdings.text: the Act and the rules must prevail over the forms and, therefore, we are inclined to overlook the technical deficiencies in the rules and, bending the law to save life, uphold the implied authority to grant suitable licences under R. 61 and 62 proviso even if liberties have to be taken with those given in Schedule A.

anchor.surface_text: the Act and the rules must prevail over the forms and, therefore, we are inclined to overlook the technical deficiencies in the rules and, bending the law to save life, uphold the implied authority to grant suitable licences under R. 61 and 62

holdings.reasoning_summary: Statutory forms are illustrative samples, not rigid; Act and rules' substance allows improvisation for practical needs like mobile distribution to protect public health.

holdings.text: Every place where storage for sale is made must be licensed. That is the plain meaning of Sec. 18(c) in fulfillment of the clear purpose, the sensitive defence of the sick.

anchor.surface_text: The police power of the State is exercised to ensure safe and potent drugs for a people peculiarly susceptible to ailments and largely ignorant of health hazards. The paramount purpose of regulation through licensing is, inter alia, to set in motion vigilant medical watch over the proper protection of drugs and medicines and the verification of the expiry of their life and the spuriousness of the products. If godowns, temporary stores and depots can remain unlicensed, they escape official attention and can deteriorate into foci of dubious or deceptive drugs harmful to society. Every place where storage for sale is made must be licensed.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Licensing every storage place ensures vigilant oversight under police power to protect public health from substandard drugs.

holdings.text: we hold that the storage, even though for short spells and on ad hoc basis and without intent to sell at that place but as part of the sales business, comes within the scope of storage for sale in Sec. 18(c) and R. 62.

anchor.surface_text: Since risk to life and health is avoided by the latter interpretation, we hold that the storage, even though for short spells and on ad hoc basis and without intent to sell at that place but as part of the sales business, comes within the scope of storage

holdings.reasoning_summary: Applying mischief rule (Heydon's case), purposive construction suppresses evasion and advances remedy by broadly interpreting 'storage for sale' to include temporary storage linked to sales business, prioritizing public health over narrow textual limits.

anchor.surface_text: The police power of the State is exercised to ensure safe and potent drugs for a people peculiarly susceptible to ailments and largely ignorant of health hazards. The paramount purpose of regulation through licensing is, inter alia, to set in motion vigilant medical watch over the proper protection of drugs and medicines and the verification of the expiry of their life and the spuriousness of the products. If godowns, temporary stores and depots can remain unlicensed, they escape official attention and can deteriorate into foci of dubious or deceptive drugs harmful to society. Every place where storage for sale is made must be licensed.
